Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored 28 of his 37 points in the second half, leading the Timberwolves to overcome a 19-point first-half deficit.
Edwards hit a step-back 3-pointer with 1:12 to play, putting the Timberwolves ahead.
Edwards drained another 3-pointer with 34.4 seconds left, extending the lead to 106-101.
Naz Reid scored 18 points off the bench and Donte DiVincenzo added 15 for Minnesota.
Rudy Gobert had a game-high 18 rebounds.
Norman Powell led the Clippers with 25 points, James Harden added 22, and Ivica Zubac had 17 points and 16 rebounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kawhi Leonard scored eight points on 3-of-11 shooting in his second game back after a right knee injury.
DiVincenzo started at point guard in place of Mike Conley, who came off the bench for the first time in his 131 games with the Timberwolves.
Julius Randle had five points for Minnesota on 2-of-10 shooting.
